title: A quick start guide to the hoodscanR package
text: hoodscanR user-friendly R package providing functions assist cellular neighborhood analysis spatial transcriptomics data single-cell resolution. functions package built based SpatialExperiment infrastructure, allowing integration various spatial transcriptomics-related packages Bioconductor. package can result cell-level neighborhood annotation output, along funtions perform neighborhood colocalization analysis neighborhood-based cell clustering.

title: A quick start guide to the hoodscanR package
text: development version hoodscanR can installed GitHub:
code: if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("hoodscanR") devtools::install_github("DavisLaboratory/hoodscanR")

title: A quick start guide to the hoodscanR package
code: library(hoodscanR) library(SpatialExperiment) library(scico)

title: A quick start guide to the hoodscanR package
text: readHoodData function can format spatialExperiment input object desired functions hoodscanR package. can look tissue cell positions using function plotTissue. test data relatively sparse low-level cell type annotations.

title: A quick start guide to the hoodscanR package
text: order perform neighborhood scanning, need firstly identify k (example, k = 100) nearest cells cells. searching algorithm based Approximate Near Neighbor (ANN) C++ library RANN package. output findNearCells function includes two matrix, annotation matrix distance matrix. can perform neighborhood analysis using function scanHoods. function incldue modified softmax algorithm, aimming genereate matrix probability cell associating 100 nearest cells. resulting can merge probabilities cell types 100 nearest cells. Now final probability distribution cell neighborhood.

title: A quick start guide to the hoodscanR package
text: plot randomly plot 10 cells see output neighborhood scanning using plotHoodMat. plot, value represent probability cell (row) located cell type neighborhood. rowSums probability maxtrix always 1.  check cells--interest parameter targetCells within function  can merge neighborhood results SpatialExperiment object using mergeHoodSpe can conduct neighborhood-related analysis. summarise neighborhood results, can use calcMetrics calculate entropy perplexity probability matrix can summarisation neighborhood distribution across tissue slide, .e. neighborhood distinct mixed. use plotTissue plot entropy perplexity. entropy perplexity measure mixture neighborhood cell, perplexity can intuitive human mind value actually mean something. example, perplexity 1 means cell located distinct neighborhood, perplexity 2 means cell located mixed neighborhood, probability 50% 50%.   can perform neighborhood colocalization analysis using plotColocal. function compute pearson correlation probability distribution cell. can see test data, endothelial cells stromal cells likely colocalize, epithelial cells dividing cells likely colocalize.  can cluster cells neighborhood probability distribution using clustByHood, based k-means algorithm set k 10. can see neighborhood distributions look like cluster using plotProbDist.  can plot clusters tissue slide, agian using plotTissue.
code: plotHoodMat(hoods, n = 10, hm_height = 5) plotHoodMat(hoods, targetCells = c("Lung9_Rep1_5_1975", "Lung9_Rep1_5_2712"), hm_height = 3) spe <- mergeHoodSpe(spe, hoods) spe <- calcMetrics(spe, pm_cols = colnames(hoods)) plotTissue(spe, size = 1.5, color = entropy) +   scale_color_scico(palette = "tokyo") plotTissue(spe, size = 1.5, color = perplexity) +   scale_color_scico(palette = "tokyo") plotColocal(spe, pm_cols = colnames(hoods)) spe <- clustByHood(spe, pm_cols = colnames(hoods), k = 10) plotProbDist(spe, pm_cols = colnames(hoods), by_cluster = TRUE, plot_all = TRUE, show_clusters = as.character(seq(10))) plotTissue(spe, color = clusters)

what: Calculate metrics for probability matrix — calcMetrics
title: Calculate metrics for probability matrix — calcMetrics
text: Calculate metrics probability matrix

title: Calculate metrics for probability matrix — calcMetrics
code: calcMetrics(spe, pm = NA, pm_cols = NA, val_names = c("entropy", "perplexity"))

title: Calculate metrics for probability matrix — calcMetrics
text: spe SpatialExperiment object. pm Optional. probability matrix. pm_cols colnames probability matrix. requires SpatialExperiment input. Assuming probability stored colData. val_names Character vector length 2. Column names used store calculated entropy perplexity.

title: Calculate metrics for probability matrix — calcMetrics
text: SpatialExperiment object. Calculated entropy perplexity saved columns colData SpatialExperiment object. Entropy perplexity calculated based information theory: P(x) probability calculated scanHoods function. Entropy H(x) = -P(x)log2(P(x)) Perplexity P(x) = 2^H(x) default, calculated entropy perplexity stored colData input spe, column name entropy perplexity.

title: Calculate metrics for probability matrix — calcMetrics
code: data("spe_test")  spe <- readHoodData(spe, anno_col = "celltypes")  fnc <- findNearCells(spe, k = 100)  pm <- scanHoods(fnc$distance) #> Tau is set to: 22747.4  pm2 <- mergeByGroup(pm, fnc$cells)  spe <- mergeHoodSpe(spe, pm2)  spe <- calcMetrics(spe, pm_cols = colnames(pm2))

title: Cluster the probability matrix with K-means — clustByHood
code: clustByHood(object, ...)  # S4 method for class 'matrix' clustByHood(object, k = 2^ncol(object) - 1, iter_max = 1000, nstart = 5)  # S4 method for class 'SpatialExperiment' clustByHood(   object,   pm_cols,   k = 0,   iter_max = 1000,   nstart = 5,   algo = "Hartigan-Wong",   val_names = "clusters" )

title: Cluster the probability matrix with K-means — clustByHood
text: object probability matrix SpatialExperiment. ... Ignore parameter. k number clusters. default 2^ncol(object)-1. iter_max maximum number iterations allowed. nstart many random sets chosen. pm_cols colnames probability matrix. requires SpatialExperiment input. Assuming probability stored colData. algo Algorithm used. Options include Hartigan-Wong, Lloyd, MacQueen. val_names Character. Column names used store clusters.

title: Cluster the probability matrix with K-means — clustByHood
text: probability matrix SpatialExperiment object. latter, clustering results saved colData SpatialExperiment object.

title: Cluster the probability matrix with K-means — clustByHood
code: m <- matrix(abs(rnorm(1000 * 100)), 1000, 100)  clust <- clustByHood(m, k = 3)

title: Find the k-th nearest cells for each cell — findNearCells
text: dat SpatialExperiment object, can generated using function readHoodData. k maximum number nearest cells compute. targetCell Specify cells target cell finding nearest cells. reportCellID Logical. Set TRUE report cell id instead cell types. reportDist Logical. Set TRUE report distance matrix. anno_col Character vector. name annotation column use.

title: Find the k-th nearest cells for each cell — findNearCells

title: Find the k-th nearest cells for each cell — findNearCells
text: findNearCells function uses nn2 function RANN package, uses Approximate Near Neighbor (ANN) C++ library. infromation ANN library please see http://www.cs.umd.edu/~mount/ANN/.

title: Find the k-th nearest cells for each cell — findNearCells
code: data("spe_test")  spe <- readHoodData(spe, anno_col = "celltypes")  fnc <- findNearCells(spe, k = 100)

what: Method to identify cellular spatial neighbourhood from single cell spatial transcriptomics data. — hoodscanR-package
title: Method to identify cellular spatial neighbourhood from single cell spatial transcriptomics data. — hoodscanR-package
text: hoodscanR implements novel method scan cell neighbourhood spatial transcriptomics data single cell level, CosMx MERFISH etc. hoodscanR takes cellular position cell type annotations inputs, allowing cellular spatial neighbourhood analysis.

title: Method to identify cellular spatial neighbourhood from single cell spatial transcriptomics data. — hoodscanR-package
text: Key neighborhood analysis functions include  findNearCells, scanHoods, mergeByGroup, calcMetrics, clustByHood. Key visualisation functions include plotTissue, plotHoodMat, plotColocal, plotProbDist.

title: Method to identify cellular spatial neighbourhood from single cell spatial transcriptomics data. — hoodscanR-package
text: Ning Liu liu.n@wehi.edu.au

what: Plot heatmap for neighbourhood analysis — plotColocal
title: Plot heatmap for neighbourhood analysis — plotColocal
text: Plot heatmap neighbourhood analysis

title: Plot heatmap for neighbourhood analysis — plotColocal
code: plotColocal(object, ...)  # S4 method for class 'matrix' plotColocal(object, hm_width = 5, hm_height = 5)  # S4 method for class 'SpatialExperiment' plotColocal(   object,   pm_cols,   self_cor = TRUE,   by_group = NULL,   hm_width = 5,   hm_height = 5,   cluster_row = TRUE,   cluster_col = TRUE,   return_matrix = FALSE )

title: Plot heatmap for neighbourhood analysis — plotColocal
text: object probability matrix SpatialExperiment. ... Ignore parameter. hm_width Integer. width heatmap. hm_height Integer. height heatmap. pm_cols colnames probability matrix. requires SpatialExperiment input. Assuming probability stored colData. self_cor Logical. default TRUE, inidicating running correlation neighbourhoods perform simple co-localization analysis. set FALSE, plot average probability neighbourhood group using by_group parameter. by_group Character. required self_cor set FALSE. cluster_row Logical. Cluster rows. cluster_col Logical. Cluster columns. return_matrix Logical. Export numeric matrix .

title: Plot heatmap for neighbourhood analysis — plotColocal
text: ComplexHeatmap plot. return_matrix set TRUE, return matrix Object.

title: Plot heatmap for neighbourhood analysis — plotColocal
code: data("spe_test")  spe <- readHoodData(spe, anno_col = "celltypes")  fnc <- findNearCells(spe, k = 100)  pm <- scanHoods(fnc$distance) #> Tau is set to: 22747.4  pm2 <- mergeByGroup(pm, fnc$cells)  spe <- mergeHoodSpe(spe, pm2)  plotColocal(spe, pm_cols = colnames(pm2))   plotColocal(spe, pm_cols = colnames(pm2), self_cor = FALSE, by_group = "cell_annotation")

Cluster rows . clusterCols Logical. Cluster columns . title Title heatmap. pm_cols colnames probability matrix. requires SpatialExperiment input. Assuming probability stored colData.

code: data("spe_test")  spe <- readHoodData(spe, anno_col = "celltypes")  fnc <- findNearCells(spe, k = 100)  pm <- scanHoods(fnc$distance) #> Tau is set to: 22747.4  pm2 <- mergeByGroup(pm, fnc$cells)  spe <- mergeHoodSpe(spe, pm2)  plotHoodMat(spe, pm_cols = colnames(pm2))

title: Plot probability distribution — plotProbDist
text: object probability matrix SpatialExperiment. ... aesthetic mappings pass ggplot2::aes_string(). targetCells Character. Optional. Assuming probability stored colData. by_cluster Logical. default TRUE, plot distribution cluster. show_clusters Character. cluster ploted, default 1 6. plot_all Logical. default FALSE, set true plot box plot instead bar plot show cells cluster. sample_size Integer. default 2, sampling two cell cluster plotted.
